1.What is this code for
This code is for our optional task 5. This code is to find the coefficients of an linear equation. If we can  find the coefficients of the linear equation,that means
the correlation between GDD and year is about linear correlation and we can predict the future GDD using the equation(this is cool). If we can not find the coefficients, that
means the correlation between GDD and year is not linear.



2.How to run this code
First, the java1.7 should be installed.
Second, we need to make sure the data file named linear_regression.txt in our TESTS folder is located in the same path as the code. Then if we want to use command line to run this code, first use cd command to get into where this code locate. 
and then use this two command  1."javac SGD_linearRegression.java" (This is compile process)
                               2."java SGD_linearRegression" (This is implementation process)
Afterwards, you can get the outputs.



3.The details of this code and results
I use the SGD, one approach that can find the coefficients of linear equation based on least squares cost function. I run this code 50 epochs, every epoch process the whole data one time and get a result. So We can get 50 results, every
result contains three outputs, the first two outputs are the coefficients and the last one is least squares cost function. The least squares cost function indicates the correctness of the coefficients, if the 
least squares cost function is more and more small along the epochs, the coefficients are more accurate. If the least squares cost function is a specific number along the epochs, the coefficients are fixed. This
coefficients are our final coefficients.



4. What is our result.
Our result is in the following

We find the least squares cost function is more and more big. This means we can not find the coefficients, which indicates that correlation between GDD and Year is not linear. So unfortunately, we can not use the linear regression to predict the future GDD
